title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the particular solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction with numerator e to the x power, minus 1, and denominator e to the y power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 1, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="f of negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
